Please connect a device Reading board type… Failed to discover services Menu title Short description of menu tile Info Enable Location disabled Notifications Disabled Bluetooth permissions denied Notification permissions denied Enable Location service On some Android phones you have to enable Location service in order to scan for Bluetooth Low Energy devices. If you can\'t find any Bluetooth devices, please ensure you have enabled Location service. Location permission In order for this app to use the Location service, you have to grant a permission first. Please keep in mind, that on some Android devices this service is needed for proper Bluetooth Low Energy device discovery. Bluetooth permissions Notification permissions Since Android 12, performing BLE-related operations (such as scanning, advertising or connecting) requires the user to explicitly grant the \"Nearby devices\" permission for the app. Please keep in mind that this app relies heavily on these system features and its capabilities will be severely reduced without them. To ensure you have the best experience with our app, we need your help! Enabling notifications allows us to keep you informed about essential updates related to your nearby Bluetooth devices. \n\n Why Enable Notifications? \n - Real-Time Alerts: Receive instant notifications about successful connections, disconnections, and any issues that may arise while using Bluetooth devices. \n - Timely Updates: Get notified when new features or device settings are available, ensuring you’re always using the latest capabilities of your connected devices. \n - Critical Reminders: Stay aware of important events, such as battery status and maintenance alerts, so you can manage your devices effectively. Your privacy is our priority, and we only send notifications that enhance your experience. \n\nPlease allow notifications so you can make the most of your Bluetooth-enabled devices. Utilize this device as a Bluetooth \n Low Energy peripheral View readings from the Health Thermometer service View info about nearby devices and their properties. Control a Dynamic Multiprotocol application of connected lights and switches Evaluate the link budget and range of EFR32 Measure throughput between the mobile device and EFR32 Control LED and receive button presses on a Silabs kit Exercise common Bluetooth operations with Silicon Labs hardware and software. Read Remote (Client) Local (Server) CONNECTION FAILED Connecting… Loading… Refreshing services… Rebooting firmware… Unknown Unknown Model Hex ASCII Decimal Unknown service Bluetooth 5 Advertising Extension Data Status: Primary PHY: Secondary PHY: Advertising Set ID: Tx Power: Periodic Advertising Interval: Not Present Complete Truncated LE 1M LE 2M LE Coded Unused The UUID dictionary contains the 128-bit UUIDs for services and characteristics that have been renamed by the user. The main purpose is simple consultation but it is also possible to change or delete them from this view. When deleted, the 128-bit UUIDs will again be shown as \"Unknown Service\" or \"Unknown Characteristic\" in the connected device\'s info screen. You can always turn them on and off in your device\'s settings. \u2022 nearby devices - makes all bluetooth-related operations (scanning, advertising, connecting) possible; crucial for this app to work as intended \u2022 location - ensures proper functioning of the bluetooth scanner \u2022 notification - This app requires notification permission to send you important alerts and updates. Please allow notifications so you can stay informed. The SoC and evaluation board (EVK) must be connected and running the correct firmware \n2. The Wi-Fi network on your mobile device should match the Wi-Fi network used for the sensor device\'s commissioning.\n3. Enable your phone\'s local network to access sensor data. A circuit board (SoC) and the evaluation board (EVK) must be connected and running proper firmwares. See here, here and here for more information. A circuit board (SoC) must be connected and running \"Bluetooth - SoC Blinky\" firmware or firmware with a title containing \"Bluetooth - SoC Dev Kit\" or \"Bluetooth - SoC Thunderboard\". A circuit board (SoC) must be connected and running firmware with a title containing \"Bluetooth - SoC Dev Kit\" or \"Bluetooth - SoC Thunderboard\". Choosing the \"No timeout\" option will result in ending the scan only when leaving the \"Scan\" feature or the app itself. 15 seconds 1 minute 2 minutes 5 minutes 10 minutes No timeout Bluetooth-related permissions are needed for this app Example: ESL Demo Add/commission ESL tags by scanning its QR code and control them from the UI ESL Network Scan QR code Refresh ESL Tags Scan QR code QR scan error: %s QR code not recognized Device terminated connection: status = %d Scan QR codes to discover \nand control ESL Tags No tags configured Group control Configured tags Turn on LED Upload a new image Display image on WSTK LCD screen Tag info icon Ping tag Remove tag Unknown state Error trying to connect ESL Tag Error trying to configure ESL Tag Error trying to ping the ESL Tag ESL Tag disconnected successfully Error trying to disconnect ESL Tag ESL Tag removed successfully Error trying to remove ESL Tag "Transferring image to the tag: %1$d%% done" Finished sending an image to the ESL Tag Image upload failed Display image failed Display image succeeded ESL operation timeout Basic State Response The ESL has detected a condition that needs service The ESL is synchronized to the AP The ESL has an active LED state: index %d The ESL has a timed LED update pending The ESL has a timed display update pending Reserved for future use Remove the ESL tag Would you like to remove the ESL tag? This is a demonstration how to update the SiWx91x firmware via Wi-Fi by downloading an image from a remote TCP server. Mobile App will act as a TCP server.
